docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES -- Gradual improvement in South American travel conditions suggests that the post-war outlook for the tourist is eventually going to be brighter than that of the pre-war Thirties. But this is not yet a fair accompli.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES -- Gradual improvement in South American travel conditions suggests that the post-war outlook for the tourist is eventually going to be brighter than that of the pre-war Thirties. But this is not yet a fair accompli.

docs.snippet: PASSPORT seekers, having weathered the battle of the reservation desks to obtain passage to foreign lands, are already forming ranks at State Department passport divisions and consulate visa departments. In fact, local passport officials state that...
docs.lead_paragraph: PASSPORT seekers, having weathered the battle of the reservation desks to obtain passage to foreign lands, are already forming ranks at State Department passport divisions and consulate visa departments. In fact, local passport officials state that the traffic already is far ahead of schedule.

headline.main: TRAVEL DOCUMENTS; Besides the Passport, Some Countries Require Several Other Papers

docs.snippet: STEAMSHIP lines and travel agents -- and their customers as well -- are trying to recapture in 1948 some of the gay and carefree quality of travel that once was common in the pre-1939 days when American tourists scattered dollars by the millions all...
docs.lead_paragraph: STEAMSHIP lines and travel agents -- and their customers as well -- are trying to recapture in 1948 some of the gay and carefree quality of travel that once was common in the pre-1939 days when American tourists scattered dollars by the millions all around the world.

headline.main: CROWDED PASSENGER SHIPS WILL PLY THE SEVEN SEAS; Atlantic and Pacific Fleets Are Being Rapidly Restored, With Small and Medium-Sized Craft Again in Favor

docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges passed through a quiet and uneventful week. Barring a one-day shock to the sterling market, a reflection of the Cripps' statement forecasting a gloomy half-year in the British Empire if the ERP is not hustled through to take care of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchanges passed through a quiet and uneventful week. Barring a one-day shock to the sterling market, a reflection of the Cripps' statement forecasting a gloomy half-year in the British Empire if the ERP is not hustled through to take care of that prospect, significant price changes were lacking. Through it all business was light.

docs.snippet: Arnold S. Denker, United States chess champion in 1944, made an auspicious start in the international masters tournament sponsored by The Jockey Club at the Hermitage Hotel in Mar del Plata, according to a report from Argentina yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Arnold S. Denker, United States chess champion in 1944, made an auspicious start in the international masters tournament sponsored by The Jockey Club at the Hermitage Hotel in Mar del Plata, according to a report from Argentina yesterday.

headline.main: DENKER VICTOR IN CHESS; Then Plays to Draw in the Argentina Masters Tourney

docs.snippet: Paired with Herman Pilnik of Buenos Aires in the third round, Arnold S. Denker, United States representative in the international chess masters' tournament at Mar del Plata, scored his second draw after forty-one moves yesterday, according to a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Paired with Herman Pilnik of Buenos Aires in the third round, Arnold S. Denker, United States representative in the international chess masters' tournament at Mar del Plata, scored his second draw after forty-one moves yesterday, according to a report from Argentina.

headline.main: DENKER AND PILNIK DRAW; American Chess Expert Misses Chance to Win in Argentina

docs.snippet: Upsets marked the fourth round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata in Argentina, according to a report from Buenos Aires yesterday. Both of the leaders before the start of play, Antonio Medina of Spain and Mendel Najdorf of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Upsets marked the fourth round of the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata in Argentina, according to a report from Buenos Aires yesterday. Both of the leaders before the start of play, Antonio Medina of Spain and Mendel Najdorf of Poland, were defeated.

headline.main: MEDINA UPSET IN CHESS; Bolbochan Victor in Argentina -- Denker in Third Draw

docs.snippet: Playing to a draw for the fourth time in succession, Arnold S. Denker of New York nevertheless maintained his place among the leaders in the international chess masters' tournament at Mar del Plata, according to reports from Argentina yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Playing to a draw for the fourth time in succession, Arnold S. Denker of New York nevertheless maintained his place among the leaders in the international chess masters' tournament at Mar del Plata, according to reports from Argentina yesterday.

headline.main: DENKER IN FOURTH DRAW; Game With Stahlberg Ends After 51 Moves in Argentine Chess

docs.snippet: Antonio Medina of Spain regained first place in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Argentina. While Jacobo Bolbochan of Argentina adjourned his seventh-round game with Laszlo Szabo of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Antonio Medina of Spain regained first place in the international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday, according to a report from Argentina. While Jacobo Bolbochan of Argentina adjourned his seventh-round game with Laszlo Szabo of Hungary, the Spanish champion defeated Carlos Maderna, Argentina, to gain a score of 4 1/2-2 1/2.

headline.main: SIXTH CHESS DRAW IN ROW FOR DENKER; He Divides 7th-Round Point With Freitas in Argentina -- Medina Regains Lead
